newsitem.title: USA: Power Computing cuts prices on Apple clones.
newsitem.headline: Power Computing cuts prices on Apple clones.

text.p: Power Computing Corp said Monday that it reduced prices on certain mid-range Apple Macintosh clone computers by about $100.
The company said PowerCenter Pro 180 dropped in price from $2,095 to $1,995.
And Power Computing said it cut prices on complete PowerCenter Pro 180 bundles.
The PowerCenter Pro 180 Complete System dropped in price from $2,695 to $2,495, the company said.
The PCs run on the Mac OS operating system software, and on PowerPC microprocessors, which serve as the brain of Apple's Macintosh computers and Macintosh clones.
PowerPC chips are jointly designed by Apple, Motorola Inc and International Business Machines Corp.
